Welcome to Rest Api’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.read_root()¶

The read_root function returns a dictionary.

Returns:

A dictionary: ‘{“message”: “Welcome to my Rest Api application”}’

Return type:

dict

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are needed by your app, like database connections or caches.

Returns:

A coroutine that is run when the server starts

REST API database¶

Module for connection to database

src.database.db.get_db()¶

The get_db function opens a new database connection if there is none yet for the current application context. It will also create the database tables if they do not exist yet.

Returns:

A context manager that provides a database session

REST API repository contacts¶

Module for direct operations, adding, getting, updating, changing and deleting contacts inside the database

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact for the specified user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – Get the data from the request body

  • user (User) – Get the user id from the token

  • db (Session) – Get the database session

Returns:

New contact

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.find_contacts(db: Session, user: User, firstname: str = None, lastname: str = None, email: str = None) → List[Contact]¶

The find_contacts function is used to search for contacts in the database.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – Session: Connect to the database

  • user (User) – User: Get the user id from the user table

  • firstname (str) – Filter the contacts by firstname

  • lastname (str) – Filter the contacts by lastname

  • email (str) – Filter the contacts by email

Returns:

A list of contacts with given parameters

Return type:

list[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_birthdays(user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

The get_birthdays function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – Get the user id from the database

  • db (Session) – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts that have birthdays within the next 7 days

Return type:

list[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(user: User, contact_id: int, db: Session) → Contact¶

The get_contact function returns a current contact for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – Get the user from the database

  • contact_id (int) – Filter the contact by id

  • db (Session) – Get the database session

Returns:

The first contact found in the database that matches the user_id and contact_id

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(user: User, skip: int, limit: int, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – Get the user_id from the user object

  • skip (int) – Skip the first n contacts

  • limit (int) – Limit the number of contacts that are returned

  • db (Session) – Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts for a user

Return type:

list[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(user: User, contact_id: int, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

The remove_contact function removes a current contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – Identify the user who is making the request

  • contact_id (int) – Identify the contact to be removed

  • db (Session) – Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact object if it was deleted, otherwise none

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(user: User, contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – Get the user id from the token

  • contact_id (int) – Identify the contact that is being updated

  • body (ContactUpdate) – Get the data from the request body

  • db (Session) – Access the database

Returns:

An updated contact object

Return type:

Contact | None

REST API repository users¶

Module for user’s direct operations getting, creating, authorization and authentication

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function sets the confirmed field of a user to True.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Get the email address of the user

  • db (Session) – Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – Create a new user

  • db (Session) – Access the database

Returns:

New user

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, then returns the user with that email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Pass the email address of the user to be retrieved

  • db (Session) – Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

User with given email

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Get the user from the database

  • url (str) – Specify the type of data that is being passed in

  • db (Session) – Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

User with given email

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – Identify the user that is being updated

  • token – Set the refresh token for a user

  • db (Session) – Commit the changes to the database

Type token:

str | None

Returns:

None

REST API routes auth¶

Module for authorization and authentication operations

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – Get the token from the url

  • db (Session) – Get the database session

Returns:

A message

Return type:

str

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – Get the username and password from the request body

  • db (Session) – Get a database session

Returns:

A dict with access token, refresh token and token type

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – Get the token from the request header

  • db (Session) – Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with access_token, refresh_token and token_type

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already a user with that email in our database, and if so it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request (Request) – Get the base url of the application

  • db (Session) – Get the database session from the dependency injection

Returns:

A dictionary with a message key

Return type:

str

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – Get the user data from the request body

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request (Request) – Get the base_url of the application

  • db (Session) – Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the user and a string

Return type:

dict

Module for contact’s operations

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – Get the data from the request body

  • user (User) – Get the user id from the token

  • db (Session) – Get the database session

Returns:

New contact

Return type:

Contact

async src.routes.contacts.find_contacts(db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), firstname: str = Query(None), lastname: str = Query(None), email: str = Query(None)) → List[Contact]¶

The find_contacts function is used to find contacts in the database.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – Get the database session

  • user (User) – Get the user id from the token

  • firstname (str) – Search for contacts by firstname

  • lastname (str) – Search for a contact by lastname

  • email (str) – Filter the contacts by email

Returns:

A list of contacts

Return type:

list[Contacts]

async src.routes.contacts.nearest_birthdays(user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The nearest_birthdays function returns the nearest birthdays of a user’s contacts.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – Get the user id from the database

  • db (Session) – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts that have birthdays within the next 7 days

Return type:

list[Contact]

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The read_contact function returns a contact by its ID.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – Get the user from the database

  • contact_id (int) – Filter the contact by id

  • db (Session) – Get the database session

Returns:

The first contact found in the database that matches the user_id and contact_id

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The read_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – Get the user_id from the user object

  • skip (int) – Skip the first n contacts

  • limit (int) – Limit the number of contacts that are returned

  • db (Session) – Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts for a user

Return type:

list[Contact]

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – Identify the user who is making the request

  • contact_id (int) – Identify the contact to be removed

  • db (Session) – Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact object if it was deleted, otherwise none

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

  • contact_id (int) – Identify the contact that is being updated

REST API routes users¶

Module for User’s operations

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_users_me function returns the current user’s information.

Parameters:

current_user (User) – Get the current user

Returns:

The current user

Return type:

User

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – Get the file from the request body

  • current_user (User) – Get the current user from the database

  • db (Session) – Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

User with updated avatar

Return type:

User

REST API services auth¶

Module for supporting authorization and authentication operations

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data (dict) – Pass the data that will be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – Set the expiration time of the access token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the user’s data

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict)¶
The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token.

The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM defined in the class. The iat (issued at) timestamp is set to now, while the exp (expiration) timestamp is set to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the token

Returns:

A token

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data (dict) – Pass in the data that you want to encode into the token

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A refresh token

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token (str) – Pass in the refresh token that was sent to the client

Returns:

The email of the user who is trying to refresh their access token

Return type:

str

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the UserResource class. It takes an access token as input and returns the user object associated with it.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – str: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

Return type:

User

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email associated with that token.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token (str) – str: Pass in the token that was sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email address of the user who is trying to verify their account

Return type:

str

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that is to be hashed

Returns:

A hash of the password

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶
The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and the hashed version of that password,

and returns True if they match, False otherwise. This is used to verify that the user’s login credentials are correct.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password (str) – Verify the password entered by the user

  • hashed_password (str) – Check if the password is correct

Returns:

A boolean value

Return type:

Boolean

REST API services email¶

The service of sending an e-mail to the user

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username (str) – Pass the username to the email template

  • host (str) – Pass the host name of the server to be used in the email template

Returns:

The token_verification

Return type:

str
